com.samsung.android.sdk.mediacontrol

Class SmcDeviceFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.mediacontrol.SmcDeviceFinder

  • public class SmcDeviceFinder
extends Object
    This class supports finding devices to play audio and video contents, to show images and to provide content.

    To use SmcDeviceFinder, create an Smc class instance in your application startup and call the Smc.initialize(Context) method. If you do not do this, the SmcDeviceFinder methods throw a RuntimeException exception.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for when devices join or leave the network.
      static interface  SmcDeviceFinder.StatusListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for SmcDeviceFinder status events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmcDeviceFinder

        public SmcDeviceFinder(Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the device finder.

        The response for this method is sent asynchronously using the SmcDeviceFinder.StatusListener.onStarted(SmcDeviceFinder, int) callback method.

        Exceptions:

        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if the Media Control package is not initialized.
        • IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if Context is null.
        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if the Media Control package is not available on the device.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the device finder.

        The response for this method is sent asynchronously using the SmcDeviceFinder.StatusListener.onStopped(SmcDeviceFinder) callback method.

      • rescan

        public void rescan()
        Refresh the list of available devices.

        Exceptions:

        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if device finder has not started.

      • getDevice

        public SmcDevice getDevice(int deviceType,
                  String id)
        Get the device with the specified device ID and device type.

        If this method is called right after start() no devices are returned.

        Use SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener to get notifications about discovered devices.

        Parameters:
        deviceType - The device type. The valid values are:
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_AVPLAYER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_PROVIDER
        id - The unique ID of the device you want to get.
        Returns:
        The device instance that matches the specified criteria. This method returns null if there is no device that matches the specified criteria. Exceptions:
        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if device finder has not started.

      • getDeviceList

        public List<SmcDevice> getDeviceList(int deviceType)
        Get the list of discovered devices with the specified device type.

        If this method is called right after start() no devices are returned.

        Use SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener to get notifications about discovered devices.

        Parameters:
        deviceType - The device type. The valid values are:
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_AVPLAYER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_PROVIDER
        Returns:
        The list of available devices that match the specified type. This method returns an empty list if there are no devices that match the specified type. Exceptions:
        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if device finder has not started.

      • getDeviceList

        public List<SmcDevice> getDeviceList(int deviceType,
                            String networkInterface)
        Get the list of discovered devices with the specified device type using the specified network interface controller

        If this method is called right after start() no devices are returned.

        Use SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener to get notifications about discovered devices.

        Parameters:
        deviceType - The device type. The valid values are:
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_AVPLAYER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_PROVIDER
        networkInterface - The name of the connected device network interface. Example values include eth0 and lo.
        Returns:
        The list of available devices that match the specified criteria. This method returns an empty list if there are no devices that match the specified criteria. Exceptions:
        • IllegalStateException - Thrown if device finder has not started.

      • setDeviceListener

        public void setDeviceListener(int deviceType,
                     SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener listener)
        Set the specified DeviceListener instance for the specified device type for events when devices join or leave the network.

        Note

        Do not use Thread.sleep() method waiting for device added/removed event because sleep() blocks the thread and the event may never be received.

        Parameters:
        deviceType - The device type. The valid values are:
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_AVPLAYER
        • SmcDevice.TYPE_PROVIDER
        listener - The SmcDeviceFinder.DeviceListener instance for receiving events when devices join or leave the network. Set to null to unregister the current listener.

      • setStatusListener

        public void setStatusListener(SmcDeviceFinder.StatusListener listener)
        Set the specified StatusListener instance for SmcDeviceFinder status events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The StatusListener instance for receiving SmcDeviceFinder status events. Set to null to unregister the current listener.
